intro: Satureja capitellata, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are fragrant and contain essential oils, making it useful in both culinary and medicinal applications. Satureja capitellata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
